statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: McNeese State 76, Sam Houston St. 64
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- Quentin Gonzales had 13 points and a game high 12 rebounds to help McNeese State move into a second place tie in the Southland Conference with a 76-64 victory over Sam Houston State on Saturday afternoon. The Cowboys (13-10, 8-4) are tied in the conference with the Bearkats (17-7, 8-4). McNeese, though, has defeated Sam Houston twice this season. J. T. Williams and Dwight Boatner scored 14 points each to lead McNeese and John Ford added 11 points. Chris Jordan led Sam Houston with 13 points and Aaron Wade had 12. McNeese outrebounded the Bearkats 37-21. Both Williams and Aldryan Wardell pulled five rebounds for the Cowboys. McNeese also made 16 steals with Ford getting five and Gonzales three. Sam Houston took an early lead but the Cowboys came back to go up by six with four minutes left in the first half. A 13-7 run by Sam Houston tied the score at 35 all at the half. McNeese scored the first seven points of the second half and held the lead the rest of the way, outscoring Sam Houston 8-3 over the final minute of play.
